message_1: A sample of Uranium-238 has an initial activity of 3200 counts per minute (cpm). Calculate the activity of the sample after 2 half-lives. Given that the half-life of uranium-238 is 4.5 billion years.
message_2:
To calculate the activity of the sample after 2 half-lives, we can use the formula:

Final activity = Initial activity * (1/2)^n

where n is the number of half-lives.

In this case, the initial activity is 3200 cpm, and we want to find the activity after 2 half-lives.

Final activity = 3200 * (1/2)^2
Final activity = 3200 * (1/4)
Final activity = 3200 * 0.25
Final activity = 800 cpm

So, the activity of the sample after 2 half-lives will be 800 counts per minute.
